entry.title: Craft of building products reading list

link.title: Craft of building products reading list

entry.content:
These are some of my favorite reads on the craft of building great products, by order of when they were written. I’ve linked short summaries wherever I wrote them.

2022

– You are your business model by Alex Johnson. “No matter how smart, disciplined, and customer-centric you are, at the end of the day, you are your business model.”
entry.summary: These are some of my favorite reads on the craft of building great products, by order of when they were written. I’ve linked short summaries wherever I wrote them.

entry.title: About me
entry.content:
Although at this point I’ve spent more time in tech startups than in neuroscience labs, I still see myself as a scientist at heart — I am interested in understanding systems, how they work, and how to change them.

Currently I am the founder of Backdrop — our goal is to build a decentralized protocol for professional networks. In short, we want to build a core piece of digital infrastructure that helps people create amazing things together.

Prior to Backdrop I led product at ResearchGate, and Feastly before that. And prior to tech I studied multiple sclerosis in labs at UCSF and Johns Hopkins.

Where to find me

– Twitter

– Substack

– Telegram
entry.summary: Although at this point I’ve spent more time in tech startups than in neuroscience labs, I still see myself as a scientist at heart — I am interested in understanding systems, how they work, and how to change them.

entry.title: My recommended reading list
entry.content:
– On Crypto

– On the future of work

– On the craft of building products

entry.title: Podcasts I’ve hosted/appeared on
entry.content:
2022

– I recorded a full season of “Tokens but How” with Sari Azout, with guests including Gaby Goldberg, Scott Komminers, Patrick Rivera, and many more Link

– “Building Cool Shit with Cool People” on Seed Club’s “Building at the Edges” podcast with Jess Sloss Link

– “Contextualizing the DAO Landscape” on the “Mint” podcast with Adam Levy Link

– “The Barriers To Great UX Design & Building A Community Of Supporters In Web3” on the “NewForum” podcast Link
